issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: The time-out is due to the delay until ELB SWF workers start polling tasks.
fields.summary: When ELB is created, the first run of SWF workflows time out

comments.body:
To verify, create a few ELBs and register instances with them. Leave them run for at least 10 minutes.

As "(eucalyptus)loadbalancing" account, run aws-cli to examine the history of SWF workflows.

For example:
aws swf --endpoint-url http://10.111.5.111:8773/services/SimpleWorkflow list-closed-workflow-executions --domain LoadbalancingDomain  --start-time-filter oldestDate=$(($(date +%s)-1800)),latestDate=$(date +%s)

All workflows should have executionStatus=CLOSED and  closeStatus=COMPLETED or CONTINUED_AS_NEW.
Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
